comments:
Build 20020205

1) Create a project called "Sori"
2) Create a connection to :cvslnxtest:/home/cvs/scratch1
3) Use the share project wizard to share Sori with the repo
 -> Workaround: click finish from page 2 because its disabled on last page
4) When "Finish" is pressed, you get two error dialogs.

Dialog 1: "Your resources could not be imported into the repository because a 
module with that name already exists.

Dialog 2: "Internal Error".

Log contents are below.  Apart from the internal error, shouldn't I be allowed 
to do this?  I would expect to be able to synchronize with everything appearing 
as a conflict.

a:98)

The NPE has been fixed for this integration build.

The workflow has changed somewhat since 1.0. The "Share Project" is for first-
time importing of a project into CVS. If the project already exists in CVS, 
you must check it out from the repositories view.

This is partly to prevent the situation you describe, where everything is a 
conflict; this is in general not a useful workflow. Typically people either 
want to (a) start working on something brand new and share it, or (b) start 
working on something that already exists, in which case they must check it out.

I agree that this is not typical usage.  But, if I somehow get into that 
situation (lost/corrupt sync info, change between team 1.0 and team 2.0, moving 
project between repositories, etc), shouldn't there be *some* way to get my 
project released?  Maybe I know that the project on the server is bogus, and I 
just want to slam it with the project I have in my workspace.  I think you can 
also get into this situation if you add a version to your workspace rather than 
loading from a stream.  Current workaround is:

1) Copy/move project to other location in filesystem
2) Add to workspace on the project on the server
3) Delete all files in workspace (leaving CVS directories), and copy other 
project back into the workspace
4) Synchronize, release.
